article:
An evolutionary 'lineage' is a sequence of species, that form a line of descent,
each new species the direct result of speciation from an immediate ancestral
species. The University of California, Berkeley resource on understanding
evolution defines a lineage as "A continuous line of descent; a series of
organisms, populations, cells, or genes connected by ancestor/descendent
relationships."
[http://evolution.berkeley.edu/evolibrary/glossary/glossary.php?start=g&end=m
Understanding Evolution, Glossary of Terms] The Oxford English
Dictionary defines biological lineage as "a sequence of species each of which is
considered to have evolved from its
predecessor."[http://www.askoxford.com/concise_oed/lineage?view=uk OED
definition of lineage] Lineages are subsets of the evolutionary tree of
life. Lineages are often determined by the techniques of molecular systematics.
